title:Pandapaxxy's Revenant Seasonal Weapons
description:Based on https://www.reddit.com/r/sharditkeepit/comments/1gxhr1r/revenant_seasonal_weapons/

// Exuviae
//notes:pandapaxxy & WarlockMaggie (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "[pandapaxxy] Rimestealer might just be one of the best perks to bless Stasis since the original Headstone. Rimestealer allows you to build Frost Armor which is incredibly useful in all activities. Extra damage resistance? We all remember changed with light giving damage resistance. It was the norm and it was odd when not used (outside of Warmind Cells). Definitely look for Rimestealer on your Exuviae. [WarlockMaggie] While Handcannons aren’t supported by Episode II’s Artifact, this Stasis 120 does provide some excellent options for both General and Advanced level play. The new hotness of Rimestealer and Headstone is a great option, while Stats for All and Frenzy will make this weapon feel incredible without a single kill required. Stability and Reload are high priorities for stat increases." Recommended MW: Stability or Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Exuviae
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "With the upcoming buff to Aggressive frame hand cannons, Precision Instrument isn't required but is still highly sought after for dealing with Overshields, healing rifts, restoration, cure, etc. Outside of that you've got Keep Away adding accuracy and range, and Lone Wolf buffing your stats. Depending on your environment and play style both are extremely strong. Explosive Payload still works for dealing extra flinch and Headstone is exceptional at denying revives in Trials." Recommended MW: Range or Stability.|tags:pvp,controller
dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=1482024992,3142289711,3619207468,555281244
dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=1482024992,3142289711,3619207468,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=1482024992,3142289711,3619207468,124408337

dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=1840239774,3142289711,3619207468,124408337
dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=1840239774,3142289711,2579169598,555281244
dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=1840239774,3142289711,2579169598,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=1840239774,3142289711,2579169598,124408337

// Exuviae
//notes:pandapaxxy & WarlockMaggie (PvP / M+KB): "[pandapaxxy] With the upcoming buff to Aggressive frame hand cannons, Precision Instrument isn't required but is still highly sought after for dealing with Overshields, healing rifts, restoration, cure, etc. Outside of that you've got Keep Away adding accuracy and range, and Lone Wolf buffing your stats. Depending on your environment and play style both are extremely strong. Explosive Payload still works for dealing extra flinch and Headstone is exceptional at denying revives in Trials. [WarlockMaggie] While a direct competitor with the Solstice-sourced Something New, Exuviae unfortunately lacks the top shelf perks like the latter for PvP. The best options are Keep Away and Lone Wolf as they both provide some stat increases but require keeping your enemies and friends away respectively. Precision Instrument continues to be a solid option whereas Explosive Payload is good for throwing off enemy player aim. Fix the Handling to your preference and then focus on Range." Recommended MW: Range, Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Liturgy
//notes:WarlockMaggie (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "It's no secret I absolutely love Stasis weapons and to get a double-fire launcher is exciting! First off, Rimestealer and Chill Clip work pretty well together. Two volleys will freeze a target, allowing Liturgy to self-proc Rimestealer. Alternatively, going hard into Blast Radius with Chain Reaction will make large icy kabooms!" Recommended MW: Blast Radius or Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Within the crucible you've got one of two options for Liturgy. // Liturgy
//notes:pandapaxxy & WarlockMaggie (PvP / M+KB): "[pandapaxxy] Within the crucible you've got one of two options for Liturgy. The first is a primer with Chill Clip and Slideways or Surplus for extra handling to swap to your energy weapon of choice. Or as a clean up weapon with Quickdraw for lightning fast ready and Chain Reaction for big booms after you secure the kill for splash on any unsuspecting enemy teammates. [WarlockMaggie] As with PvE, Rimestealer and Chill Clip are both good perks, but the self-contained synergy is harder to come by. Instead, you'll want to utilize each perk opportunistically. Using more generic PvP perks like Perpetual Motion and Harmony might be better ultimately..." Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Red Tape
//notes:WarlockMaggie (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "(Prerelease notes) No bureaucracy here, Red Tape delivers a solid set of perks! Spec into Stability, Recoil mitigation and/or Reload for your Barrels and Magazines. And with stats handled, you can get grenade energy back with Demolitionist or get Frost Armor via Rimestealer, plus create crystals with Headstone or just do a chunk of damage with Focused Fury or Adrenaline Junkie!" Recommended MW: Stability or Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Red Tape
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Red Tape doesn't do anything exceptional but it does play into Stasis shenanigans if you use the crystals to gain a new sightline. You don't have to be near the Stasis crystal or enemy which means you can get Frost Armor from anywhere across the map. Keep Away and Lone Wolf also lean into this but don't give as many benefits. Explosive Payload would be great for fighting duals as the extra flinch is incredibly frustrating to fight against." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller

// Red Tape
//notes:pandapaxxy & WarlockMaggie (PvP / M+KB): "[pandapaxxy] Red Tape doesn't do anything exceptional but it does play into Stasis shenanigans if you use the crystals to gain a new sightline. You don't have to be near the Stasis crystal or enemy which means you can get Frost Armor from anywhere across the map. Keep Away and Lone Wolf also lean into this but don't give as many benefits. Explosive Payload would be great for fighting duals as the extra flinch is incredibly frustrating to fight against. [WarlockMaggie] I’m definitely going to be looking for a roll or few of this as it is our only non-Exotic Lightweight Stasis Scout. On par with the stats of Echoes’ Patron of Lost Causes, Red Tape does have better perks for PvP, including some unique combos like Closing Time + High-Impact Reserves. As with other longer range weapons, focus on Stability and Handling both in Masterwork, Magazine and/or Barrels." Recommended MW: Stability, Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb

// Insurmountable
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Insurmountable looks to be a decent Void sidearm for most activities. The issue is most sidearms don't scare up to GM levels easily. The synergy is there but when it takes 2-3 mags to down a red bar what's the point. In low end activities it can be incredibly strong. Just please don't take it into any real high power level activities." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Insurmountable
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "However, in the crucible where health is normalized you can do a lot with this pew pew. It bridges the gap between a traditional sidearm and a hand cannon well enough that you can slay out within CQC. Lone Wolf will make those shots feel sticky and Desperate Measures can scale with any subclass ability. Closing Time is interesting but wouldn't be my first pick. If you swap weapons a lot then look for Harmony and Threat Detector for maximum feel and damage." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Noxious Vetiver
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Did we need another arc submachine gun? We just recently got Subjunctive and IKELOS_SMG_v1.0.3 both of which have better 3rd column perks. Jolting Feedback allowing you to inflict Jolt without a reload is great and plays into Loose Change easier than with Voltshot. Precision frame SMGs have not been popular in PvE for quite some time but they are easy to use." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Noxious Vetiver
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Noxious Vetiver could be an Antiope-D replacement in the energy slot, or a better comparison is Shayura’s Wrath. Noxious Vetiver has two weaknesses compared to Shayura's Wrath. The first is a lower zoom at 14 compared to 15. The other is a lack of perks in the third and fourth columns. Target Lock is fine but isn't Kill Clip. To the Pain is a fantastic sleeper perk not many people are using but it's not Keep Away or Zen Moment. So in not so many words it is not as good as Shayura's Wrath." Recommended MW: Range.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=825495813&perks=3250034553,3142289711,3938834702,365154968
dimwishlist:item=825495813&perks=1482024992,3142289711,3938834702,365154968

// Scavenger's Fate
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Scavenger's Fate fits an interesting niche. Outside of Void Synergy you also have Discord in the third column to be paired with Surrounded or Frenzy for ammo back and some hard hitting shots. The naturally tighter spread on enemies will also contribute to it feeling great. At the end of the day it's still a shotgun, ask yourself if it's worth using in PvE." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Scavenger's Fate
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Matador 64, Retold Tale, Compass Rose, Prophet Of Doom and now Scavenger's Fate. Oh how this archetype suddenly became crowded. Lone Wolf or Slideshot coupled with Closing Time will be the roll to get, it's unique enough compared to the other offerings, so at worst give it a shot. At best it could replace that crusty Matador and give the Ogre a break." Recommended MW: Range or Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller

// Sovereignty
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Holy cow did I not see this coming. A sniper that doesn't only have perks mixed in different slots, but a sniper that can apply Weaken. Explosive Payload will give you a slight damage bump and apply Weaken with Withering Gaze. This sniper doesn't really fit the conventional deal of great DPS or single target damage, nor does it “add clear” like other weapons could. It's almost like Bungie took the normal sniper perks, put them into a jar and shook them up." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Sovereignty
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Sovereignty has even worse perks for PvP. No Moving Target, no Snapshot Sights, no Opening Shot, no Surplus, no Slickdraw or Quickdraw. Nothing. It does have Withering Gaze to apply Weaken which in the crucible would be extremely strong. But really, nothing to supplement it outside of a splash with Explosive Payload." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=3818198556&perks=1840239774,3142289711,3038247973,1134488199
dimwishlist:item=3818198556&perks=839105230,3142289711,3038247973,1134488199
dimwishlist:item=3818198556&perks=4090651448,3142289711,3038247973,1134488199

// Vantage Point
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Without a standalone reload perk Vantage Point feels a little lackluster. Keep Away does give a sizable reload boost coupled with a reload MW or loader mods on your gauntlets you can make this weapon feel pretty quick. Stats for All does work with Jolting Feedback to instantly get you to max stacks after applying Jolt which is a nifty trick. Eddy Current’s buff to instantly apply the benefits when amplified is great but if you're using Prismatic or just using Jolting Feedback for add clear and aren't investing into Arc you're better off with either of the other perks." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

dimwishlist:item=3830941962&perks=1482024992,3230963543,684456054,3047969693

// Vantage Point
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / Controller): "Adaptive frame pulse rifles have fallen off a bit with the exception of Bygones which will be toned down by the time this releases. Keep Away and Headseeker are great neutral perks but Vantage Point really exists as a neutral weapon. There are good damage perks like Swashbuckler that moves the needle to allow for a clean 6c kill but there are also better pulses that can two burst." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pvp,controller
dimwishlist:item=3830941962&perks=839105230,3142289711,3619207468,460017080

// Bitter/Sweet
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Envious Arsenal is the new hotness and Bitter/Sweet is one such hotness to get. Any of your favorite damage perks in the fourth column paired with Envious Arsenal is an easy damage rotation. It works best with Bait and Switch as both have similar activation requirements but Explosive Light is fantastic and Cascade Point has better burst DPS." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Bitter/Sweet
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "For grenade launchers to be competitive in the crucible you need to hit or surpass 70 blast radius to kill all resilience levels. Volatile Launch and High-Explosive Ordinance both hit that with some room to spare. If you don't get that far you'd need to invest into a blast radius MW. Otherwise you can go velocity to make up for the lack of Impulse Amplifier. Unrelenting is great for going on sprees but if you're just running and gunning you should opt for Explosive Light to get even more damage per shot (i.e. forgiveness)." Recommended MW: Blast Radius or Velocity.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=2599338625&perks=1478423395,1380253176,1428297954,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=2599338625&perks=1478423395,1380253176,1428297954,557221067
dimwishlist:item=2599338625&perks=1478423395,1380253176,3108830275,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=2599338625&perks=1478423395,1380253176,3108830275,557221067
dimwishlist:item=2599338625&perks=1844523823,1380253176,1428297954,3194351027

// Heretic's Fervor
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Did we need another generic rocket launcher? No, did we get one? Kinda. Rimestealer and Chill Clip immediately brings something more compared to other Stasis rockets but is it enough? Do you use rockets for add clear? No? Neither do I. It's a novelty but I'd rather use tried and true perks like Field Prep or Auto-Loading Holster coupled with Explosive Light for quick bursts of damage." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Heretic's Fervor
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Yeah you see that right. QuickDraw in both column 3 and 4. Double Quickdraw. Super fast. Outside of that weirdness, go for Tracking Module for better chances to hit your intended target, Chill Clip to slow any stragglers or Explosive Light to really up your damage. Double Quickdraw." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pvp,mkb,controller
